snippet: Should either candidate refuse to accept the outcome on Nov. 8, there are a number of ways he or she could try to change it, but they are nearly all on a state-by-state basis....
abstract: Process for disputing outcome of presidential election in United States, as Donald Trump has threatened, would be mammoth and expensive undertaking; electoral process in US is exceptionally decentralized and challenging presidential election would require campaign to challenge results on state-by-state basis; steps involved in mounting formal challenge highlighted.
lead_paragraph: Should either candidate refuse to accept the outcome on Nov. 8, there are a number of ways he or she could try to change it, but they are nearly all on a state-by-state basis.

headline.main: Could Donald Trump Reject the Election Results? Yes. Would It Do Any Good? Nope.
headline.print_headline: Disputing Vote Is an Uphill Battle
